author: Mindzweeper
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

1) Create a DSC Resource with multiple instances of SPConfigWizard.
2) Make sure deployment works fine without encryption of MOF credentials.
3) Configure encryption of MOF credentials.

Expected behavior
-----------------

Deployment should work fine.

Actual behavior
---------------

```
The resources ('[SPConfigWizard]RunConfigWizard0' and '[SPConfigWizard]RunConfigWizard1') have conflicting values of
the following properties: 'PsDscRunAsCredential'. Ensure that their values match. LCM failed to start desired state
configuration manually.
    + CategoryInfo          : ResourceExists: (root/Microsoft/...gurationManager:String) [], CimException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : MI RESULT 11
    + PSComputerName        : localhost
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.14409.1005
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.14409.1005
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```
Note:  I tried reproducing in 6.0.0-beta.3, but could not find Start-DSCConfiguration in PSDesiredStateConfiguration resource in the Server 2012 R2 build.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This isn't an issue we can address in this repo

title: Salted PsDscRunAsCredentials considered conflicting values across DSC resource instances
